@graph.name: Elbows in Red pepper Alfredo with red onions and Asparagus! Vegan - Vegan Richa

itemListElement.name: Elbows in Red pepper Alfredo with red onions and Asparagus! Vegan

@graph.name: Elbows in Red Pepper Alfredo with Red Onion and Asparagus. Vegan.
@graph.description: A simple and quick fun meal! Red pepper alfredo sauce made using either cashews or silken tofu, with some spices and veggies. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 1/2  medium red pepper chopped ((can be substituted with roasted red peppers))
1/2 cup cashews soaked for an hour ((can be substituted by silken tofu))
1/2 teaspoon onion powder ((or a tablespoon of red onions cooked to golden))
1/2 teaspoon cajun spice ((optional, I like cajun spice and roasted red pepper together))
1/2 teaspoon sea salt or to taste
2 cups Elbows or any pasta ((cooked as per instructions on the package))

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, add a teaspoon of olive oil, garlic and dried red chili.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan, add a teaspoon of olive oil, garlic and dried red chili.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook for 2 minutes on medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook for 2 minutes on medium heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped red pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, till the peppers start to brown (5-7 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the chopped red pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, till the peppers start to brown (5-7 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, add the cooked peppers, garlic, chili. Add in the soaked cashews, onion powder(or a tablespoon of cooked onions), garlic powder, cajun spice, salt to taste and 2 teaspoons olive oil. You can use roasted red peppers instead of cooked red peppers, and silken tofu instead of soaked cashews as well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, add the cooked peppers, garlic, chili. Add in the soaked cashews, onion powder(or a tablespoon of cooked onions), garlic powder, cajun spice, salt to taste and 2 teaspoons olive oil. You can use roasted red peppers instead of cooked red peppers, and silken tofu instead of soaked cashews as well.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend well, use a little water if needed and blend into a creamy mixure.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend well, use a little water if needed and blend into a creamy mixure.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, add a teaspoon of canola oil, and add in the chopped red onion and sliced asparagus or any other veggies you want to add.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, add a teaspoon of canola oil, and add in the chopped red onion and sliced asparagus or any other veggies you want to add.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook on medium low heat for 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally till both are cooked well and start to brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook on medium low heat for 7-8 minutes, stirring occasionally till both are cooked well and start to brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the red pepper alfredo and cooked elbows or any other pasta.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the red pepper alfredo and cooked elbows or any other pasta.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss well to coat. Adjust salt and spice and cook on low heat for 4-5 minutes or until the alfredo gets hot enough to bubble and the required consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss well to coat. Adjust salt and spice and cook on low heat for 4-5 minutes or until the alfredo gets hot enough to bubble and the required consistency.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot topped with nutritional yeast or daiya vegan cheese or fresh parsley!.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot topped with nutritional yeast or daiya vegan cheese or fresh parsley!.
